comments.author: Skip Patterson

comments.text:
I have a theory:
In early 2008 the GOP took a good look at the mess that was going to be 
left by GWB, and realized that whoever inherited that mess would eventually 
be blamed for it, and would be roundly hated for the tough and unpopular 
policies that would be required to fix it.  Consequently, whoever was 
elected in 2008 would probably be a one-term president, and would damage 
his or her party, too. 

So the GOP decided they didn't WANT to win the election.  They didn't want 
the hate.

If they lost, they could wait until 2012, they'd win for sure then, the 
hard nasty stuff would have been done, and they could coast for the next 16 
years, at least, with no manure on their feet.  (It's called long-term 
strategy.)

"So, who should we run?"
"Why not John.  He's been trying for 16 years, and this might be his last 
shot, so how 'bout we let him have one full campaign?"
"Well, ok, but he's popular.  War hero and all that.  What if he 
accidentally wins?"
"Well, we can't allow that.  We'll have to torpedo his campaign somehow."
"How do we do that?"
"We get him a special running mate.  A scary one.  A woman would be good - 
make it look like we care about women, too.  There's this woman in 
Alaska....."

Kaboom!

They were much more serious about the 2012 campaign.  But so much for 
long-term strategy.  They didn't know how to stop the torpedoes.﻿
